intro: Symplocos elegans var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, showy, violet-blue berries that appear in the fall. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in partial to full shade and is often found in moist, wooded areas. The berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
